name: Sweet-Sour Green Bean Soup
author: Cookiemonster
summary: This is a tangy soup that my mother used to make. I couldn't find another recipe like it, so thought I would write it down for my own sake and share it for others.
ingredients: 3  potatoes, cut into cubes, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
¼ cup apple cider vinegar, or to taste
2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste
directions: Place potatoes and green beans into a large pot
Pour enough water over potatoes and green beans just to cover and season with salt and pepper; bring to a boil
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes
Place bacon in a large skillet; cook and stir over medium-high heat until evenly browned, about 10 minutes
Stir flour into bacon until flour forms a paste, 2 to 3 minutes
Mix bacon mixture into potato mixture; bring to a boil and cook until thickened, 5 to 10 minutes
Mix vinegar and sugar into soup
